page.title: 08Arable Farming Around Chard
page.content: The main crop is{grass}.Sown fields are sprayed to reduce weeds and fertilizers are added to improve growth.{Silage}is made by cutting the grass,allowing it to wilt for a time and then stacking it with added minerals and sometimes mollasses in a silage clamp.The grass ferments to produce a strong smelling substance which is much loved by cattle. {Hay,}which once far outweighed silage ,needs better weather as it has to be thoroughly dried before baling.Round bales are becoming more popular but most farmers still make the traditional oblong variety. The commonest{cereal}crop is{barley} but lately more farmers have been putting fields down to{oil seed rape. This plant is well known for turning the fields bright yellow at flowering time and is harvested by combining.
